billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO CIVIL SERVICE AND PENSIONS

title: Repeals provisions mandating payroll deductions from public employees who engage in prohibited strikes
summary: Repeals provisions mandating a payroll deduction at twice the daily rate of pay for each day a public employee engages in an illegal strike.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2570

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                   January 26, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen.  KRUGER -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Civil Service and Pensions

       AN ACT to repeal paragraph (f) of subdivision 2 of section  210  of  the
         civil  service  law,  relating to the prohibition of strikes by public
         employees and individual penalties

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1. Paragraph (f) of subdivision 2 of section 210 of the civil
    2  service law is REPEALED.
    3    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.








        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD06401-01-1
actClause: AN ACT to repeal paragraph (f) of subdivision 2 of section 210 of the civil service law, relating to the prohibition of strikes by public employees and individual penalties
